Class Cluster

java.lang.Object
com.github.cowwoc.digitalocean.resource.kubernetes.Cluster
public final class Cluster extends Object
A Kubernetes cluster.

  • Method Details

    • configuration

      public static ClusterConfiguration configuration(DigitalOceanClient client, String name, Zone zone, KubernetesVersion version, List<Cluster.NodePoolConfiguration> nodePools)
      Creates a new cluster configuration.
      Parameters:
      client - the client configuration
      name - the name of the node pool
      zone - the zone that the droplet is deployed in
      version - the software version of Kubernetes
      nodePools - the node pools that are deployed in the cluster
      Returns:
      the configuration
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if any of the arguments are null
      IllegalArgumentException - if any of the arguments contain leading or trailing whitespace or are empty

    • getByZone

      public static List<Cluster> getByZone(DigitalOceanClient client, Zone zone) throws IOException, TimeoutException, InterruptedException
      Returns the clusters that are deployed in a zone.
      Parameters:
      client - the client configuration
      zone - the zone
      Returns:
      the clusters
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if any of the arguments are null
      IllegalStateException - if the client is closed
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs. These errors are typically transient, and retrying the request may resolve the issue.
      TimeoutException - if the request times out before receiving a response. This might indicate network latency or server overload.
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting for a response. This can happen due to shutdown signals.

    • getByName

      public static Cluster getByName(DigitalOceanClient client, String name) throws IOException, TimeoutException, InterruptedException
      Looks up a cluster by its name.
      Parameters:
      client - the client configuration
      name - the name
      Returns:
      null if no match is found
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if any of the arguments are null
      IllegalArgumentException - if name contains leading or trailing whitespace or is empty
      IllegalStateException - if the client is closed
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs. These errors are typically transient, and retrying the request may resolve the issue.
      TimeoutException - if the request times out before receiving a response. This might indicate network latency or server overload.
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting for a response. This can happen due to shutdown signals.

    • getIpv4

      public String getIpv4()
      Returns the public IPv4 address of the Kubernetes control plane. This value will not be set if high availability is configured on the cluster.
      Returns:
      an empty string if not set

    • update

      public void update(ClusterConfiguration target) throws IOException, TimeoutException, InterruptedException, KubernetesClusterNotFoundException
      Updates the cluster to the desired configuration.
      Parameters:
      target - the desired state
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if target is null
      IllegalArgumentException - if the server does not support applying any of the desired changes
      IllegalStateException - if the client is closed
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs. These errors are typically transient, and retrying the request may resolve the issue.
      TimeoutException - if the request times out before receiving a response. This might indicate network latency or server overload.
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting for a response. This can happen due to shutdown signals.
      KubernetesClusterNotFoundException - if the cluster could not be found
      See Also:
      • ClusterConfiguration.copyUnchangeablePropertiesFrom(Cluster)

    • waitFor

      public Cluster waitFor(Cluster.State state, Duration timeout) throws IOException, TimeoutException, InterruptedException, KubernetesClusterNotFoundException
      Blocks until the cluster reaches the desired state or a timeout occurs.
      Parameters:
      state - the desired state
      timeout - the maximum amount of time to wait
      Returns:
      the updated cluster
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if state is null
      IllegalStateException - if the client is closed
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs. These errors are typically transient, and retrying the request may resolve the issue.
      TimeoutException - if the operation times out before the cluster reaches the desired status. This might indicate network latency or server overload.
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting for a response. This can happen due to shutdown signals.
      KubernetesClusterNotFoundException - if the cluster could not be found
      See Also:
      • waitForDeletion(Duration)

    • destroyRecursively

      public void destroyRecursively() throws IOException, TimeoutException, InterruptedException
      Destroys the cluster and all of its associated resources.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the client is closed
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs. These errors are typically transient, and retrying the request may resolve the issue.
      TimeoutException - if the request times out before receiving a response. This might indicate network latency or server overload.
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting for a response. This can happen due to shutdown signals.

    • waitForDeletion

      public void waitForDeletion(Duration timeout) throws IOException, TimeoutException, InterruptedException
      Blocks until the cluster deletion completes.
      Parameters:
      timeout - the maximum amount of time to wait
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if state is null
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs. These errors are typically transient, and retrying the request may resolve the issue.
      TimeoutException - if the operation times out before the cluster reaches the desired status. This might indicate network latency or server overload.
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting for a response. This can happen due to shutdown signals.
